Title: Single Leaf of Shah Sarmad and Prince Dara Shikoh
Medium: opaque watercolor and ink on paper mounted on pasteboard
Description: According to inscriptions written in Nasta'liq script, this painting, Walters manuscript leaf W.912, depicts the Mughal prince Dara Shikoh (born 1024 AH/AD 1615) and the holy man Shah Sarma seated under a tree. Behind the wise man stands an attendant with a peacock-feather fan. A celebrated scholar, sufi, and ruler, Dara Shikoh was the eldest son of Shah Jahan. On the back is a page of calligraphy signed with the epithet Jawahir raqam. There are wide polychrome and illuminated borders on both sides of the leaf.
CreditLine: Gift of John and Berthe Ford, 2002
Keywords: Indian; Islamic; Mughal; Calligraphy; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Miniature; Painting; Album; India
Provenance: John and Berthe Ford, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 2002, by gift.
Creator: Indian
